_fileDescription: Expected text strings and element data for drag-and-drop E2E tests. Tests load this file via cy.fixture('drag-drop') and compare these values against actual page content. The drag-and-drop page at /drag_and_drop has two columns labeled A and B inside a #columns container. Dragging one column onto the other swaps their text content. Columns have no individual IDs -- they are identified by their position (first-child vs last-child).
_pageHeading_description: The h3 heading text on the /drag_and_drop page. Note this page uses h3 (not h2 like the login page).
_columnA_description: The text content of the first (left) column in its initial state before any drag operations.
_columnB_description: The text content of the second (right) column in its initial state before any drag operations.
_containerSelector_description: The CSS selector for the container div that holds both draggable columns.
_columnSelector_description: The CSS selector matching both column elements. Each column has the 'column' class.
_headingSelector_description: The CSS selector for the page heading element.
_columnCount_description: The expected number of draggable columns on the page.
_draggableAttribute_description: The HTML attribute that makes elements draggable. Both columns have draggable='true' set by the application's JavaScript.
_columnClass_description: The CSS class name applied to each individual column element.
_url_description: The URL path for the drag-and-drop page, relative to baseUrl.
